member.name: T:Elmah.AboutPage
member.summary: Renders an HTML page that presents information about the version, build configuration, source files as well as a method to check for updates.

member.name: T:Elmah.ErrorPageBase
member.summary: Provides the base implementation and layout for most pages that render HTML for the error log.

member.name: T:Elmah.ApplicationException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a non-fatal error occurs. This exception also serves as the base for all exceptions thrown by this library.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.

member.name: T:Elmah.AccessErrorLog
member.summary: An implementation that uses Microsoft Access as its backing store.
member.remarks: The MDB file is automatically created at the path specified in the connection string if it does not already exist.

member.summary: When overridden in a subclass, ends an asynchronous version of .

member.summary: When overridden in a subclass, ends an asynchronous version of .

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorLog.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets the name of the application to which the log is scoped.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorLog.Default
member.summary: Gets the default error log implementation specified in the configuration file, or the in-memory log implemention if none is configured.

member.name: M:Elmah.AccessErrorLog.#ctor(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a dictionary of configured settings.

member.name: M:Elmah.AccessErrorLog.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class to use a specific connection string for connecting to the database.

member.name: M:Elmah.AccessErrorLog.Log(Elmah.Error)
member.summary: Logs an error to the database.
member.remarks: Use the stored procedure called by this implementation to set a policy on how long errors are kept in the log. The default implementation stores all errors for an indefinite time.

member.name: M:Elmah.AccessErrorLog.GetErrors(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.IList)
member.summary: Returns a page of errors from the databse in descending order of logged time.

member.summary: Returns the specified error from the database, or null if it does not exist.

member.name: P:Elmah.AccessErrorLog.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of this error log implementation.

member.name: P:Elmah.AccessErrorLog.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets the connection string used by the log to connect to the database.

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.AssertionFactoryHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will be responsible for creating an assertion object and initializing it from an XML configuration element.

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.AssertionFactory
member.summary: Holds factory methods for creating configured assertion objects.

member.name: M:Elmah.Assertions.AssertionFactory.DecodeClrTypeNamespaceFromXmlNamespace(System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.remarks: Ideally, we would be able to use SoapServices.DecodeXmlNamespaceForClrTypeNamespace but that requires a link demand permission that will fail in partially trusted environments such as ASP.NET medium trust.

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.ComparisonAssertion
member.summary: An assertion implementation whose test is based on whether the result of an input expression evaluated against a context matches a regular expression pattern or not.

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.IAssertion
member.summary: Provides evaluation of a context to determine whether it matches certain criteria or not.

member.name: M:Elmah.Assertions.IAssertion.Test(System.Object)
member.remarks: The context is typed generically as System.Object when it could have been restricted to System.Web.HttpContext and also avoid unnecessary casting downstream. However, using object allows simple assertions to be unit-tested without having to stub out a lot of the classes from System.Web (most of which cannot be stubbed anyhow due to lack of virtual and instance methods).

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.CompositeAssertion
member.summary: Read-only collection of instances.

member.name: T:Elmah.DataBinder
member.summary: Provides data expression evaluation facilites similar to in ASP.NET.

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.JScriptAssertion
member.summary: An assertion implementation that uses a JScript expression to determine the outcome.
member.remarks: Each instance of this type maintains a separate copy of the JScript engine so use it sparingly. For example, instead of creating several objects, each with different a expression, try and group all expressions that apply to particular context into a single compound JScript expression using the conditional-OR (||) operator.

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.JScriptAssertion.PartialTrustEvaluationStrategy
member.summary: Uses the JScript eval function to compile and evaluate the expression against the context on each evaluation.

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.JScriptAssertion.FullTrustEvaluationStrategy
member.summary: Compiles the given expression into a JScript function at time of construction and then simply invokes it during evaluation, using the context as a parameter.

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.RegexMatchAssertion
member.summary: An assertion implementation whose test is based on whether the result of an input expression evaluated against a context matches a regular expression pattern or not.

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.StaticAssertion
member.summary: An static assertion implementation that always evaluates to a preset value.

member.name: T:Elmah.Assertions.TypeAssertion
member.summary: An assertion implementation whose test is based on whether the result of an input expression evaluated against a context matches a regular expression pattern or not.

member.name: F:Elmah.Build.Status
member.summary: This is the status or milestone of the build. Examples are M1, M2, ..., Mn, BETA1, BETA2, RC1, RC2, RTM.

member.name: P:Elmah.Build.ImageRuntimeVersion
member.summary: Gets a string representing the version of the CLR saved in the file containing the manifest. Under 1.0, this returns the hard-wired string "v1.0.3705".

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of application in which this error occurred.

member.summary: Gets or sets name of host machine where this error occurred.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type, class or category of the error.

member.summary: Gets or sets the source that is the cause of the error.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.Message
member.summary: Gets or sets a brief text describing the error.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.Detail
member.summary: Gets or sets a detailed text describing the error, such as a stack trace.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.User
member.summary: Gets or sets the user logged into the application at the time of the error.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.Time
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time (in local time) at which the error occurred.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.StatusCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP status code of the output returned to the client for the error.
member.remarks: For cases where this value cannot always be reliably determined, the value may be reported as zero.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.WebHostHtmlMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML message generated by the web host (ASP.NET) for the given error.

member.name: P:Elmah.Error.ServerVariables

member.name: T:Elmah.ErrorDetailPage
member.summary: Renders an HTML page displaying details about an error from the error log.

member.name: T:Elmah.ErrorDigestRssHandler
member.summary: Renders an RSS feed that is a daily digest of the most recently recorded errors in the error log. The feed spans at most 15 days on which errors occurred.

member.name: T:Elmah.ErrorDisplay
member.summary: Provides miscellaneous formatting methods for

member.name: M:Elmah.ErrorDisplay.HumaneExceptionErrorType(System.String)
member.summary: Formats the type of an error, typically supplied as the value, in a short and human- readable form.
member.remarks: Typically, exception type names can be long to display and complex to consume. The essential part can usually be found in the start of an exception type name minus its namespace. For example, a human reading the string, "System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException", will usually considers "COM" as the most useful component of the entire type name. This method does exactly that. It assumes that the the input type is a .NET Framework exception type name where the namespace and class will be separated by the last period (.) and where the type name ends in "Exception". If these conditions are method then a string like, "System.Web.HttpException" will be transformed into simply "Html".

member.name: M:Elmah.ErrorDisplay.HumaneExceptionErrorType(Elmah.Error)
member.summary: Formats the error type of an object in a short and human-readable form.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.MailSender
member.summary: Gets the e-mail address of the sender.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.MailRecipient
member.summary: Gets the e-mail address of the recipient, or a comma-/semicolon-delimited list of e-mail addresses in case of multiple recipients.
member.remarks: When using System.Web.Mail components under .NET Framework 1.x, multiple recipients must be semicolon-delimited. When using System.Net.Mail components under .NET Framework 2.0 or later, multiple recipients must be comma-delimited.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.MailCopyRecipient
member.summary: Gets the e-mail address of the recipient for mail carbon copy (CC), or a comma-/semicolon-delimited list of e-mail addresses in case of multiple recipients.
member.remarks: When using System.Web.Mail components under .NET Framework 1.x, multiple recipients must be semicolon-delimited. When using System.Net.Mail components under .NET Framework 2.0 or later, multiple recipients must be comma-delimited.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.MailSubjectFormat
member.summary: Gets the text used to format the e-mail subject.
member.remarks: The subject text specification may include {0} where the error message () should be inserted and {1} where the error type should be insert.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.MailPriority
member.summary: Gets the priority of the e-mail.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.SmtpServer
member.summary: Gets the SMTP server host name used when sending the mail.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.SmtpPort

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.AuthUserName

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.AuthPassword
member.summary: Gets the clear-text password to use if the SMTP server requires authentication.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.NoYsod
member.summary: Indicates whether YSOD is attached to the e-mail or not. If true, the YSOD is not attached.

member.name: P:Elmah.ErrorMailModule.UseSsl
member.summary: Determines if SSL will be used to encrypt communication with the mail server.

member.summary: Helper methods for array containing culturally-invariant strings. The main reason for this helper is to help with po

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AssertionMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method is assertion method, i.e. it halts control flow if one of the conditions is satisfied. To set the condition, mark one of the parameters with attribute.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AssertionConditionAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the condition parameter of the assertion method. The method itself should be marked by attribute. The mandatory argument of the attribute is the assertion type.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Annotations.AssertionConditionAttribute.#ctor(JetBrains.Annotations.AssertionConditionType)
member.summary: Initializes new instance of AssertionConditionAttribute.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Annotations.AssertionConditionAttribute.ConditionType
member.summary: Gets condition type.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AssertionConditionType
member.summary: Specifies assertion type. If the assertion method argument satisifes the condition, then the execution continues. Otherwise, execution is assumed to be halted.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.AssertionConditionType.IS_TRUE
member.summary: Indicates that the marked parameter should be evaluated to true.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.AssertionConditionType.IS_FALSE
member.summary: Indicates that the marked parameter should be evaluated to false.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.AssertionConditionType.IS_NULL
member.summary: Indicates that the marked parameter should be evaluated to null value.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.AssertionConditionType.IS_NOT_NULL
member.summary: Indicates that the marked parameter should be evaluated to not null value.

member.name: T:Elmah.JsonTextWriter
member.summary: Represents a writer that provides a fast, non-cached, forward-only way of generating streams or files containing JSON Text according to the grammar rules laid out in RFC 4627.
member.remarks: This class supports ELMAH and is not intended to be used directly from your code. It may be modified or removed in the future without notice. It has public accessibility for testing purposes. If you need a general-purpose JSON Text encoder, consult JSON.org for implementations or use classes available from the Microsoft .NET Framework.

member.name: T:Elmah.ManifestResourceHandler
member.summary: Reads a resource from the assembly manifest and returns its contents as the response entity.

member.name: T:Elmah.Mask
member.summary: Collection of utility methods for masking values.

member.name: T:Elmah.MemoryErrorLog
member.summary: An implementation that uses memory as its backing store.
member.remarks: All instances will share the same memory store that is bound to the application (not an instance of this class).

member.name: F:Elmah.MemoryErrorLog.MaximumSize
member.summary: The maximum number of errors that will ever be allowed to be stored in memory.

member.name: F:Elmah.MemoryErrorLog.DefaultSize
member.summary: The maximum number of errors that will be held in memory by default if no size is specified.

member.name: M:Elmah.MemoryErrorLog.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a default size for maximum recordable entries.

member.name: M:Elmah.MemoryErrorLog.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specific size for maximum recordable entries.

member.name: M:Elmah.MemoryErrorLog.#ctor(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a dictionary of configured settings.

member.name: M:Elmah.MemoryErrorLog.Log(Elmah.Error)
member.summary: Logs an error to the application memory.
member.remarks: If the log is full then the oldest error entry is removed.

member.name: M:Elmah.MemoryErrorLog.GetError(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the specified error from application memory, or null if it does not exist.

member.name: M:Elmah.MemoryErrorLog.GetErrors(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.IList)
member.summary: Returns a page of errors from the application memory in descending order of logged time.

member.name: P:Elmah.MemoryErrorLog.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of this error log implementation.

member.name: T:Elmah.MsAjaxDeltaErrorLogModule
member.summary: Module to log unhandled exceptions during a delta-update request issued by the client when a page uses the UpdatePanel introduced with ASP.NET 2.0 AJAX Extensions.

remarks.para: This module is ONLY required when dealing with v1.0.x.x of System.Web.Extensions.dll (i.e. the downloadable version to extend v2.0 of the .Net Framework)
Using it with v3.5 of System.Web.Extensions.dll (which shipped as part of v3.5 of the .Net Framework) will result in a duplication of errors.
This is because MS have changed the implementation of System.Web.UI.PageRequestManager.OnPageError
In v1.0.x.x, the code performs a brutal Response.End(); in an attempt to "tidy up"! This means that the error will not bubble up to the Application.Error handlers, so Elmah is unable to catch them.
In v3.5, this is handled much more gracefully, allowing Elmah to do its thing without the need for this module!

member.name: M:Elmah.MsAjaxDeltaErrorLogModule.LogException(System.Exception,System.Web.HttpContext)
member.summary: Logs an exception and its context to the error log.

member.name: T:Elmah.OracleErrorLog
member.summary: An implementation that uses Oracle as its backing store.

member.name: M:Elmah.OracleErrorLog.#ctor(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a dictionary of configured settings.

member.name: M:Elmah.OracleErrorLog.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class to use a specific connection string for connecting to the database.

member.name: M:Elmah.OracleErrorLog.Log(Elmah.Error)
member.summary: Logs an error to the database.
member.remarks: Use the stored procedure called by this implementation to set a policy on how long errors are kept in the log. The default implementation stores all errors for an indefinite time.

member.name: M:Elmah.OracleErrorLog.GetErrors(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.IList)
member.summary: Returns a page of errors from the databse in descending order of logged time.

member.name: M:Elmah.OracleErrorLog.GetError(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the specified error from the database, or null if it does not exist.

member.name: P:Elmah.OracleErrorLog.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of this error log implementation.

member.name: P:Elmah.OracleErrorLog.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets the connection string used by the log to connect to the database.

member.summary: Displays a "Powered-by ELMAH" message that also contains the assembly file version informatin and copyright notice.

member.summary: Renders the contents of the control into the specified writer.

member.name: T:Elmah.SccStamp
member.summary: Represents a source code control (SCC) stamp and its components.

member.name: M:Elmah.SccStamp.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes an instance given a SCC stamp ID. The ID is expected to be in the format popularized by CVS and SVN.

member.name: M:Elmah.SccStamp.FindAll(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Finds and builds an array of instances from all the attributes applied to the given assembly.

member.name: M:Elmah.SccStamp.FindLatest(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Finds the latest SCC stamp for an assembly. The latest stamp is the one with the highest revision number.

member.name: M:Elmah.SccStamp.FindLatest(Elmah.SccStamp[])
member.summary: Finds the latest stamp among an array of objects. The latest stamp is the one with the highest revision number.

member.name: M:Elmah.SccStamp.SortByRevision(Elmah.SccStamp[])
member.summary: Sorts an array of objects by their revision numbers in ascending order.

member.name: M:Elmah.SccStamp.SortByRevision(Elmah.SccStamp[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sorts an array of objects by their revision numbers in ascending or descending order.

member.name: P:Elmah.SccStamp.Id
member.summary: Gets the original SCC stamp ID.

member.name: P:Elmah.SccStamp.Author
member.summary: Gets the author component of the SCC stamp ID.

member.name: P:Elmah.SccStamp.FileName
member.summary: Gets the file name component of the SCC stamp ID.

member.name: P:Elmah.SccStamp.Revision
member.summary: Gets the revision number component of the SCC stamp ID.

member.name: P:Elmah.SccStamp.LastChanged
member.summary: Gets the last modification time component of the SCC stamp ID.

member.name: P:Elmah.SccStamp.LastChangedUtc
member.summary: Gets the last modification time, in coordinated universal time (UTC), component of the SCC stamp ID in local time.

member.name: T:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog
member.summary: An implementation that uses XML files stored on disk as its backing store.

member.name: M:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog.#ctor(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a dictionary of configured settings.

member.name: M:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog.MapPath(System.String)
member.remarks: This method is excluded from inlining so that if HostingEnvironment does not need JIT-ing if it is not implicated by the caller.

member.name: M:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class to use a specific path to store/load XML files.

member.name: M:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog.Log(Elmah.Error)
member.summary: Logs an error to the database.
member.remarks: Logs an error as a single XML file stored in a folder. XML files are named with a sortable date and a unique identifier. Currently the XML files are stored indefinately. As they are stored as files, they may be managed using standard scheduled jobs.

member.name: M:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog.GetErrors(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.IList)
member.summary: Returns a page of errors from the folder in descending order of logged time as defined by the sortable filenames.

member.name: M:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog.GetError(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the specified error from the filesystem, or throws an exception if it does not exist.

member.name: P:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog.LogPath
member.summary: Gets the path to where the log is stored.

member.name: P:Elmah.XmlFileErrorLog.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of this error log implementation.
